results.name: Number of distinct prime factors of 2^n+1.
comment: The length of row n in A060444.
link: Amiram Eldar, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1062 (terms 0..500 from T. D. Noe)
example: For n=7, 129 = 3.43 has 2 prime factors, so a(7) = 2.
xref: Cf. A000051, A001221, A060444, A086257 (number of primitive prime factors).
results.author: _Labos Elemer_
